page.title: 13STOCKPORT TIP IS NOW AMENITY
page.content: The South Reddish side of the{Tame} { Valley}was once dominated by the { Asherbottom, Grimesbottom and} { Woodhall}refuse tips. The three tips were merged and the tipping area increased to 10 hectares by diverting the river. Controlled tipping took place from 1963 onwards and over 1 million tonnes of rubbish was dumped. The tip was closed in 1978 as part of the{Tame Valley Development Scheme.} Top soil covered the rubbish. As plants took hold the area became a green field. 1985 has seen further landscaping. Trees have been planted to screen the area from the road on the western side. A pond has been dug. This valuable amenity area is less then a mile from Stockport centre. You would never guess now what lies beneath it.
